topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack 2.0: Adding a VSA Node

section.p: You may have a need to add a VSA node for additional storage capacity or another purpose and these steps will help you achieve this.

section.title: Prerequisites
section.p: You should have one or more baremetal servers that meet the minimum hardware requirements for a VSA node which are documented in the Hard Support Matrix.

section.title: Adding a VSA Node
section.p: These steps will show you how to add the new VSA node to your servers.yml file and then run the playbooks that update your cloud configuration. You will run these playbooks from the lifecycle manager.

ol.li: Log in to your lifecycle manager.
Checkout the site branch of your local git so you can begin to make the necessary edits: cd ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/data git checkout site

In the same directory, edit your servers.yml file to include the details about your new VSA node(s).
For example, if you alrady had a cluster of three VSA nodes and needed to add a fourth one you would add your details to the bottom of the file in this format: # VSA Storage Nodes
- id: vsa4 ip-addr: 10.13.111.148 role: VSA-ROLE server-group: RACK1 nic-mapping: HP-DL360-4PORT mac-addr: f0:92:1c:05:f5:78 ilo-ip: 192.168.9.4 ilo-password: password ilo-user: admin
You can find detailed descriptions of these fields here. You will need to verify that the ip-addr value you choose for this node does not conflict with any other IP address in your cloud environment. You can confirm this by checking the ~/stack/helion/my_cloud/info/address_info.yml file on your lifecycle manager.
Commit the changes to git: git commit -a -m "Add node <name>"
Run the configuration processor: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost config-processor-run.yml
Run the ready deployment playbook: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost ready-deployment.yml
Add the new node into Cobbler: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost cobbler-deploy.yml

Then you can image the node: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost bm-reimage.yml -e nodelist=<node name> If you don't know the <node name> already, you can get it by using sudo cobbler system list
Before proceeding, you may want to take a look at info/server_info.yml to see if the assignment of the node you have added is what you expect. It may not be, as nodes will not be numbered consecutively if any have previously been removed. This is to prevent loss of data; the config processor retains data about removed nodes and keeps their ID numbers from being reallocated. See the Persisted Server Allocations section in HPE Helion OpenStack 2.0 Input Model for information on how this works.

Run the following deployment step specifying the --limit option to apply the deployment actions only to the target node(s). cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts site.yml --limit hlm004-ccp-comp0007*

body.section: Adding a New VSA Node to Monitoring If you want to add a new VSA node to the monitoring service checks, there is an additional playbook that must be run to ensure this happens: cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts monasca-deploy.yml --tags active_ping_checks
